title: How to Put Out a Candle with Your Fingers

steps.title: Light your candle.
steps.content: Light your candle. It should be at least 1 inch (2.5 cm) high and freestanding. Make sure you can pull your hand away quickly.

steps.title: Lick your fingers.
steps.content: Lick your fingers. This is an important part of the process. Do not skip it! Licking your fingers adds a layer of water that protects your skin from getting burned

steps.title: Place your hand about 1 inch (2.5 cm) away from the flame/wick.
steps.content: Place your hand about 1 inch (2.5 cm) away from the flame/wick. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Quickly grab the wick and then let go.
steps.content: Quickly grab the wick and then let go. This should put out your flame. If it does not, blow out your candle, shorten your wick and try again. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Practice.
steps.content: Practice. Eventually with practice you can do this without licking your fingers, but you must master the timing first. Be warned! [3] X Research source
